column2: ready to make lunch. Tim wanted to make a big bowl of pasta. The pasta box was full. Tim believed the pasta box was full. A bird flies into the kitchen through the open window. Tim starts boiling water to cook the pasta.;pasta box

building a birdhouse. Molly wanted to use the pile of lumber to make the birdhouse. The lumber was rough. Molly believed the lumber was rough. A kite gets stuck in a tree in the garden. Molly starts to cut the lumber to build the birdhouse.;lumber

column1: Rob was at the toy store
column2: looking for a gift. Rob wanted to buy an amazing toy car that he saw in a package. The package was full of toy cars. Rob believed the package was full of toy cars. A child drops a toy on the floor. Rob takes the package to the counter to buy it.;package

watching the impressive clown show. Henry wanted to get the clown's autograph. The clown was in the big top. Henry believed the clown was in the big top. A juggler starts performing near the hot dog stand. Henry plans to approach the clown in the big top for the autograph.;clown

ready to play a game of baseball. Yara wanted to put her baseball in her bag. The baseball was dirty. Yara believed the baseball was dirty. A frisbee lands near Yara. Yara plans to clean the baseball herself.;baseball

looking for a book to read. Mary wanted to find a mystery book from an unknown author that was kept in a special case. The case was locked. Mary believed the case was locked. A light bulb in the library goes out. Mary asks the librarian for the key to the case.;Case

taking care of the horses. Fred wanted to rescue a dry hay bale to feed the horses. The hay bale was big and heavy. Fred believed the hay bale was big and heavy. A tractor drives by the ranch. Fred plans to carry the big and heavy hay bale to the horses.;hay bale

column1: Yara was at the science fair
column2: standing near her project. Yara wanted to demonstrate how her oxygen machine worked. The oxygen machine was off. Yara believed the oxygen machine was off. A balloon pops at a nearby stall. Yara plans to turn the machine on for the demonstration.;oxygen machine

looking at a wild Viking shield. Ethan wanted to sketch the shield for his art project. The shield was hanging on the wall. Ethan believed the shield was hanging on the wall. A child accidentally knocks over a sign. Ethan continues to sketch the shield from where he is.;shield

trying to find shells. Fred wanted to show his friends a special shell that he found. The shell was blue. Fred believed the shell was blue. A beach ball rolls near Fred. Fred starts to put the shell in his bag.;shell

making a video for her friends. Yara wanted to show her modest doll collection in the video. The dolls were all in bright colors. Yara believed the dolls were in bright colors. A toy car rolls across the floor. Yara continues to name each doll in her video.;dolls

column1: Rita was in the university library
column2: studying for her exams. Rita wanted to use a tidy notebook for her notes. The notebook was new and stiff. Rita believed the notebook was new and stiff. A book falls off a shelf in the library. Rita starts writing notes in the notebook.;notebook

column1: Yara was at her lively birthday party
column2: playing a game of pin the tail on the donkey. Yara wanted to win the game by hitting the target. The donkey poster was clean. Yara believed the donkey poster was clean. A balloon pops. Yara tries to pin the tail on the donkey poster.;donkey poster

taking care of his plants. Ken wanted to lend his friend a beautiful cactus from his collection. The cactus pot was full of soil. Ken believed the cactus pot was full of soil. A kite lands in the backyard. Ken starts to carefully remove the cactus from the pot to transfer it.;cactus pot

ready for a day of fun. Harry wanted to relax in his large kayak. The kayak was tied to the dock. Harry believed the kayak was tied to the dock. A frisbee lands near Harry's feet. Harry gets into the kayak to start relaxing.;kayak

preparing for a camping trip. Will wanted to pack his flashlight in his backpack. The flashlight was working well. Will believed the flashlight was working well. A ball bounces into the room. Will puts the flashlight in his backpack.;flashlight

playing basketball. Harry wanted to throw the ball into the basket. The basket was empty. Harry believed the basket was empty. A kite flies over the basketball court. Harry throws his ball towards the basket.;basket

feeding the chickens. Tina wanted to give the frightened chicken some corn. The chicken coop door was open. Tina believed the chicken coop door was open. A tractor passes by in the distance. Tina starts pouring the corn into the chicken coop.;chicken coop door

getting ready for a virtual singing competition. Nia wanted to use her new microphone for the competition. The microphone was in a box on her desk. Nia believed the microphone was in the box. The power goes out in the house. Nia plans to open the box and set up the microphone.;microphone

column2: learning to bake. Val wanted to make a perfect apple pie. The pie crust was smooth. Val believed the pie crust was smooth. The doorbell rings. Val starts to fill the pie crust with apples.;pie crust
